intro: Mesembryanthemum rupicola, commonly known as the rock mesembryanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent and drought-resistant characteristics. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom during the cooler months. It is often used in rock gardens due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
